sections.title: Hunter (Class Overview)
sections.description: Overview of the Hunter class including role, alignment, hit die, and starting wealth.

sections.title: Weapon and Armor Proficiency (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters are proficient with all simple and martial weapons, light and medium armor, and shields except tower shields.

sections.title: Spell Casting (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters cast divine spells from the druid and ranger spell lists (druid spells 6th level and lower), using spontaneous casting like a sorcerer with Wisdom as their casting ability score.

sections.title: Orisons (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters learn 0-level spells called orisons that can be cast at will without consuming spell slots and have alignment restrictions on spell casting.

sections.title: Animal Companion (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters gain a druid-style animal companion that can learn skirmisher tricks and provides enhanced summoning duration when the companion is dead.

sections.title: Animal Focus (Su) (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters can take on animal aspects as a swift action for limited duration and permanently apply different aspects to their animal companion, with various enhancement bonuses and special abilities based on the chosen animal.

sections.title: Nature Training (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters count their full hunter level as both druid and ranger levels for qualifying for feats, traits, and options that affect animal companions.

sections.title: Wild Empathy (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters can improve animal attitudes using a Diplomacy-like check with their hunter level and Charisma modifier, affecting animals and low-Intelligence magical beasts.

sections.title: Precise Companion (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 2nd level, hunters choose either Precise Shot or Outflank as a bonus feat without meeting prerequisites, automatically granting Outflank to their companion if chosen.

sections.title: Track (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters add half their level to Survival checks made to follow tracks.

sections.title: Hunter Tactics (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 3rd level, hunters automatically grant all their teamwork feats to their animal companion without the companion needing to meet prerequisites.

sections.title: Teamwork Feat (Hunter)
sections.description: Hunters gain bonus teamwork feats every 3 levels and can change their most recent teamwork feat as a standard action a limited number of times per day.

sections.title: Improved Empathic Link (Su) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 4th level, hunters gain an empathic link with their companion and can see through the companion's eyes as a swift action within 1 mile, becoming blinded while doing so.

sections.title: Woodland Stride (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 5th level, hunters and their companions move through natural undergrowth at normal speed without damage, but are still affected by magical terrain.

sections.title: Bonus Tricks (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 7th level and every 6 levels thereafter, the hunter's animal companion learns an additional bonus trick beyond those from effective druid level.

sections.title: Second Animal Focus (Su) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 8th level, hunters can use two different animal aspects simultaneously on themselves and assign two aspects to their companion.

sections.title: Swift Tracker (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 8th level, hunters can track at normal speed without penalty and take reduced penalties when tracking at double speed.

sections.title: Raise Animal Companion (Sp) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 10th level, hunters gain raise animal companion as a spell-like ability that gives them a permanent negative level for 24 hours, upgrading to resurrection at 16th level.

sections.title: Speak with Master (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 11th level, hunters and their animal companion can communicate verbally as if using a common language, incomprehensible to others without magic.

sections.title: Greater Empathic Link (Su) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 14th level, the empathic link range extends to 10 miles and allows telepathic communication within 1 mile.

sections.title: One with the Wild (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 17th level, animals matching the hunter's current animal foci won't attack unless compelled or attacked first, and the hunter can demoralize such animals as a swift action.

sections.title: Master Hunter (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 20th level, hunters can always track at full speed without penalty and gain one permanent animal focus active all day in addition to their normal uses.

sections.title: Huntmaster (Ex) (Hunter)
sections.description: At 20th level, hunters gain a second animal companion treated as 4 levels lower and can assign different animal aspects to each companion.
